lead_paragraph: ROOME--Dorothy Anne, (nee Haigney), passed away peacefully on the evening of May 16, 2016, after a long and courageous battle with cancer. A longtime resident of Manhattan, Anne distinguished herself as an attorney, a painter, a wife, a sister to six siblings, and as a devoted friend to many. Born in Manhattan on June 3, 1944, she was the eldest child of the late attorney John E. Haigney and his late wife, also named Dorothy Anne. She grew up in Larchmont, New York, and graduated with a bachelor's degree in Fine Arts at Manhattanville College in Purchase in 1966. After graduation, she moved to Manhattan where she resided for the rest of her life. In 1971, she was betrothed to the late Phillip L. Roome who died in 1993. After years of running her household and producing numerous fine oil paintings in her spare time, Anne determined to pursue a legal career by enrolling in Fordham Law School whence she graduated in 1983. From then until her father's retirement in 1997, she was associated with the law firm he had founded and managed, Ide, Haigney & Rado. After she retired from the practice of law, Anne remained active in church and social affairs until her illness prevented her participation. She is mourned by her loving brothers, Stacy, Mark, and Paul, sisters Kate, Jennifer and Courtney, companion Fanny Coll, and innumerable close friends and relatives. A memorial service will be held at the Church of St. Augustine (corner of Larchmont and Cherry Avenues) in Larchmont on Saturday, June 18, at 11am. 1/3

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  ROOME, DOROTHY ANNE
